alert.note: Alert for Chambers (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 9:49AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Chambers County through 1030 AM CDT... At 949 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Standing Rock to near Camp Hill. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Valley, Lanett, Lafayette, Stroud, La Fayette, Lakeview, Five Points, Cusseta, Post Oak Forks, Denson, River View, Amity Park, Sturkie, Standing Rock, Welch, Buffalo, Chambers County Lake, Fredonia, Veasey Creek Park and Huguley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
